contentList.content: This book teaches you to channel the power of source from your surroundings. With time and focus, you can harness source at will.
The Flow of Source, Part I
The Flow of Source, Part I
This book teaches you to harness source more effectively. As your knowledge expands, so does your ability to channel source.
The Flow of Source, Part II
The Flow of Source, Part II
An Ancient Tome on Source. This tome is the culmination of knowledge passed down by the best of this Academy. It surely holds many secrets on mastering the flow.
The Flow of Source, Part III
The Flow of Source, Part III
Within these pages is a song, about the Divine and his sorrow.
This book will teach you how to siphon your Source to others.

CHANGELOG

14th May 2020 - Implemented Mod-Menu dialog. Renamed and swapped skills. Created a script to grant skillbooks that the player missed in their playthrough; recipes exist for back-compatibility. Implemented an in-game changelog and notification system. Full localization pass. Divinity Unleashed compatibility can now be toggled with the mod-menu, old database-toggle removed. Fixed CS-I skillbook being consumable.

10th April 2020 - Added Divinity Unleashed Compatibility Script. Assigned stats to the skillbooks (forgot to do this at launch).

20th March 2020 - Initial Release.

Hello sourcerors,
I am the author of the mod, Channel Source. I hope you are enjoying your playthrough of Divinity Original Sin 2.
You are getting this letter because Channel-Source was recently updated. It's difficult to reach all of you through steam, especially as you have no reason to return to the steam-page after you've hit subscribe. The best way to disseminate information then, in my opinion, is to pass it directly to the player, in-game. So moving forward, you will receive this and the "changelog" every time the mod updates. This way, you'll be notified when my mods update and see what changed without leaving Rivellon! You are, of course, free to ignore and discard both items should you wish.
Firstly, and most importantly, I would like to remind you that most mods are created by individuals like you and me, in their free time. As such, there is high-likelihood that mistakes fall through the cracks and weird unforeseeable events to occur. You are always advised to err on the side of caution and backup your saves. It's something you should always do, for any game, and for any mod. I will also advise keeping a backup of your mod-list. In case an update screws up, you can still continue playing with the old version. I extend this advice to official game patches/updates too, seeing as how buggy game-releases are these days.
Now, regarding this mod. This update brings in a bunch of backend infrastructure (that I'll no doubt use in all my mods going forward), some fixex, and a Mod-Menu (with cringy dialog). I wished to squeeze in more but couldn't delay the update any further. You can access the mod-menu by combining any Channel-Source skill book with an Identifying-Glass. The menu, currently, lets you acquire the books that you missed during your journey, provide you with a new changelog and toggle the compatibility script for Divinity Unleashed. More stuff will be added to it as I feel the need. This update is practically a remaster, as, in addition to the new stuff, I secretly swap all skills and skill-books from your characters with new-ones (for better compatibility). The old recipes will continue to exist, for those who already have them in crafting-book, but I will remove all mention of them from the steam-page. They are now deprecated.
The mod already uses the script-extender if it's installed. However, it may become a hard-requirement in the future. Depending on what additional stuff is added to this mod. Since the mod didn't launch with any requirements (because I never intended to add much to it), I feel it is necessary to give you guys a heads-up.
I wish you people, the best of luck, in Rivellon, and in real life.

A Friend.
[Add Missing Books] You feel that your understanding is incomplete. There must be something you missed.

As you inspect the book, it begins to glow and crackle with "source". Contrary to your initial observations, it is revealed to be written in an anomalous language you can't recognize but can still comprehend. The same language that defines the rules of our universe perhaps. The book, it seems, is a modification of those rules, and grants you a certain degree of control.
[Toggle Scripted Source-gain Mode] Enabling switches the mod to restore source by using scripts instead of statuses.
In an act of inexplicable communication, the book awaits a response, ready to manifest your will.

The book imprints the following indecipherable information in your mind:
Mod Identifier: [CSModID_d30774ed-d944-4296-8b64-e8bca65acb23]
Installed On: [InstalledOn_cb99b60e-de2b-47f7-acd0-9a4ce882a388]
Compatibility Script: [DUBAFix_a2da2866-73d9-4907-95d6-35f262321ca3]
Please install Norbyte's script-extender to access skill-configuration options.
[Configure Stats] Modify stat-attributes like action-point cost and cooldown.
[Skill Configuration] Attempt to change the behaviour of the skills.

Enable if the skills don't restore source-points. Enabling switches the mod to restore source by using scripts instead of statuses.
Current Status: [DUBAFix_a2da2866-73d9-4907-95d6-35f262321ca3]
[Request Changelog] You wish to know what has changed since the last time you read the book.
[Toggle Mutual Cooldown] When enabled, casting a Channel-Source skill will put all other Channel-Source skills on cooldown as well.
As you attempt to piece together sporadic knowledge, the book listens. Your wish materializes into the remaining books.
The book responds to your request. A new changelog materializes infront of you.

A source-infused log, unlike any livewood you've ever seen. Touching it invokes visons and memories of the past - especially events of significant change. This one, in particular, seems related to the Channel-Source books.
An anonymous letter. The writer claims to be the author of the "Channel-Source" books.
You Channel the <font color='#008080'>Source</font> around you.
You Channel the <font color='#008080'>Source </font>with greater effect.
You Channel the <font color='#008080'>Source</font> like a true Godwoken.
You bless the <font color='#008080'>Source </font>down in Rivellon.
You Channel the Source around you. Gain <font color='#008080'>1 Source-Point.</font>
You Channel the Source with greater effect. Gain <font color='#008080'>2 Source-Points.</font>
You Channel the Source like a true Godwoken. Gain <font color='#008080'>3 Source-Points.</font>
You bless the Source down in Rivellon. Everyone in a 7m Radius is <font color='#FFFFFF'>Blessed</font> and gains <font color='#008080'>3 Source-Points.</font>
Transfer <font color='#008080'>Source</font> to the desired target.
Transfer <font color='#008080'>Source</font> to the desired target.
